div.bibl: The Sentinel, Volumes 23-24; Week of October 6, 1916, Page 24.

body.p: Thirty thousand employees in the garment manufacturing industry of Chicago, a large majority of them Jewish menand women, were granted increases which will place $1,000,000 extra pay in their envelopes during the next year.

The announcement was made by the Wholesale Clothiers Association, also composed principally of Jewish employers. The working time was reduced from fifty hours to forty eight hours a week. The change goes into effect on December 1.
